intro: Bellevalia abortiva, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows from a bulbous stem and produces showy blooms during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is adapted to survive in dry, rocky environments. Bellevalia abortiva is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in low-water conditions.
